title: Jobberman Jobs Scraper
description: Scrape jobs from Jobberman.com. Provide either Keyword/Location inputs OR one of the Start URL inputs (Start URL, URL, or Start URLs).

startUrl.title: Start URL
startUrl.description: A single Jobberman.com search URL to start from. If provided, Keyword/Location inputs are ignored.

url.title: URL (alias for Start URL)
url.description: An alias for 'Start URL' for compatibility. If provided, Keyword/Location inputs are ignored.

startUrls.title: Start URLs (replaces all other inputs)
startUrls.description: An array of start URLs. Overrides all other inputs (Keyword, Location, Start URL).

keyword.title: Keyword (if not using Start URLs)
keyword.description: Job search keyword(s), e.g., 'Software Developer', 'Marketing Manager', 'Data Analyst', 'Nurse', 'Sales Representative'.

location.title: Location (if not using Start URLs)
location.description: Geographic location to search in, e.g., 'Lagos', 'Abuja', 'Port Harcourt', 'Ibadan', 'Kano'.

posted_date.title: Posted Date (if not using Start URLs)
posted_date.description: Filter jobs by how recently they were posted.

collectDetails.title: Collect job details
collectDetails.description: If enabled, scraper opens job detail pages for full description/salary.

results_wanted.title: Maximum number of jobs
results_wanted.description: The maximum number of jobs to collect. If left empty, the Actor will default to 100 jobs.

max_pages.title: Maximum number of pages
max_pages.description: A safety cap on the number of search result pages to visit. If left empty, the Actor will default to 999 pages.

proxyConfiguration.title: Proxy configuration
proxyConfiguration.description: Use Apify Proxy for the best results.

cookies.title: Custom cookies (raw header)
cookies.description: Optional raw 'Cookie' header string. Can help bypass consent banners.

cookiesJson.title: Custom cookies (JSON)
cookiesJson.description: Optional JSON-formatted cookies. Accepts an array (e.g., [{"name":"a","value":"1"}]) or an object map (e.g., {"a":"1"}).
